page.title: 01Area To NE Of Middleton
page.content: The area is bounded to the SW by the River Tees and rises to 520 metres in the NW and 470m in the NE. The two roads running N to Stanhope were built in the early 19th century by the London Lead Company to service their lead mining operations. In the south below approx 300m cattle are grazed but the remainder of the area is only suitable for sheep. The northrn half is subject to snow cover in the winter with high winds and the sheep are them moved to lower ground. In the SW corner there are two intensive pig farms. The lower half of Eggleston Burn runs through pleasant woods and is visited by tourists in summer. Swimming is possible in the deeper pools. At 9840252 in the supposed site of a stone circle removed long ago to provide building stone. Stotley Hall 9680255 is a 2-storied
